entries.meaning: (aviation, with the) A dangerous sensory illusion where the pilot of an aircraft believes themself to be in a bank when they are actually wings-level, or vice-versa, often resulting in spatial disorientation and loss of control of the aircraft.
examples: If you don't use your flight instruments when flying in cloud, you can easily get the leans and enter a fatal graveyard spiral.

entries.meaning: third-person singular simple present indicative form of lean
